1562     * {@link HyperellipticalMap} is also a nice option because it can project onto a shape between a
1563     * rectangle (like this class) and an ellipse (like EllipticalMap), with all-round sides.
1564     * <a href="http://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/SphereWorld.png" >Example map</a>.
1565     */
1566//     * <a href="http://i.imgur.com/wth01QD.png">Example map, showing distortion</a>
1567    @Beta
1568    public static class SphereMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1569        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1570        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1571        private double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1572                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1573                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1574
1575        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1576        public final double[][] xPositions,
1577                yPositions,
1578                zPositions;
1579
1580
1581        /**
1582         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1583         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1584         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1585         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
1586         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1587         * If you were using {@link SphereMap#SphereMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1588         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
1589         */
1590        public SphereMap() {
1591            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1592        }
1593
1594        /**
1595         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1596         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1597         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1598         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1599         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1600         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1601         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1602         *
1603         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1604         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1605         */
1606        public SphereMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1607            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
1608        }
1609
1610        /**
1611         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1612         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1613         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1614         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1615         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1616         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1617         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1618         *
1619         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1620         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1621         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1622         */
1623        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1624            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1625        }
1626
1627        /**
1628         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1629         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1630         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1631         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1632         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1633         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1634         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
1635         *
1636         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1637         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1638         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1639         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1640         */
1641        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
1642            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
1643        }
1644
1645        /**
1646         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1647         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1648         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1649         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1650         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1651         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1652         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1653         *
1654         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1655         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1656         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1657         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
1658         */
1659        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
1660            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
1661        }
1662
1663        /**
1664         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1665         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1666         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1667         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
1668         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
1669         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
1670         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
1671         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
1672         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
1673         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
1674         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
1675         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
1676         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
1677         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
1678         * that don't require zooming.
1679         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1680         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1681         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1682         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
1683         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1684         */
1685        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
1686            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
1687            xPositions = new double[width][height];
1688            yPositions = new double[width][height];
1689            zPositions = new double[width][height];
1690
1691            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
1692            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
1693            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
1694            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
1695            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
1696        }
1697        @Override
1698        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
1699            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
1700        }
1701
1702        /**
1703         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
1704         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
1705         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
1706         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
1707         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
1708         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
1709         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
1710         * @param latitude the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
1711         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
1712         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
1713         */
1714        // 0.7978845608028654 1.2533141373155001
1715        @Override
1716        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
1717            int x = (int)((((longitude - getCenterLongitude()) + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * 0.15915494309189535 * width),
1718                    y = (int)((NumberTools.sin(latitude) * 0.5 + 0.5) * height);
1719            return Coord.get(
1720                    wrapX(x, y),
1721                    wrapY(x, y));
1722        }
1723
1724        /**
1725         * Copies the SphereMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only be
1726         * shared to Noise classes.
1727         * @param other a SphereMap to copy
1728         */
1729        public SphereMap(SphereMap other)
1730        {
1731            super(other);
1732            terrain = other.terrain;
1733            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
1734            heat = other.heat;
1735            moisture = other.moisture;
1736            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
1737            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
1738            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
1739            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
1740            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
1741            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
1742            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
1743            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
1744            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
1745            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
1746        }
1747
1748        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
1749                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
1750        {
1751            boolean fresh = false;
1752            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
1753            {
1754                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1755                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1756                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1757                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1758                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1759                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1760                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1761                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1762                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1763                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1764                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1765                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1766                cacheA = stateA;
1767                cacheB = stateB;
1768                fresh = true;
1769            }
1770            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
1771            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
1772            int t;
1773
1774            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
1775            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
1776
1777            double p,
1778                    ps, pc,
1779                    qs, qc,
1780                    h, temp,
1781                    i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 2.0 / (height+2.0),//(3.141592653589793) / (height+2.0),
1782                    xPos = startX, yPos, i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h / (height+2.0);
1783            final double[] trigTable = new double[width << 1];
1784            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
1785                p = xPos * i_w + centerLongitude;
1786                // 0.7978845608028654 1.2533141373155001
1787                trigTable[x<<1]   = NumberTools.sin(p);// * 1.2533141373155001;
1788                trigTable[x<<1|1] = NumberTools.cos(p);// * 0.7978845608028654;
1789            }
1790            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1791            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1792                qs = -1 + yPos;//-1.5707963267948966 + yPos;
1793                qc = NumberTools.cos(NumberTools.asin(qs));
1794                //qs = qs;
1795                //qs = NumberTools.sin(qs);
1796                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++) {
1797                    ps = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.sin(p);
1798                    pc = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.cos(p);
1799                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
1800                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
1801                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
1802                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
1803                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
1804                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
1805                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
1806                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
1807                            , qs, seedB));
1808                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
1809                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
1810                            , seedC));
1811
1812                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
1813                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
1814                    if(fresh) {
1815                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
1816                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
1817
1818                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
1819                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
1820
1821                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
1822                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
1823                    }
1824                }
1825                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
1826                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
1827
1828            }
1829            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
1830                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
1831                    hMod;
1832            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1833            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1834            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1835
1836            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1837                temp = Math.abs(yPos - 1.0);
1838                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
1839                temp = 2.2 - temp;
1840                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1841//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
1842//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
1843//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
1844                    h = heightData[x][y];
1845                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
1846                    hMod = 1.0;
1847                    switch (t) {
1848                        case 0:
1849                        case 1:
1850                        case 2:
1851                        case 3:
1852                            h = 0.4;
1853                            hMod = 0.2;
1854                            break;
1855                        case 6:
1856                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
1857                            break;
1858                        case 7:
1859                            h *= -0.25;
1860                            break;
1861                        case 8:
1862                            h *= -0.4;
1863                            break;
1864                        default:
1865                            h *= 0.05;
1866                    }
1867                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
1868                    if (fresh) {
1869                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
1870                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
1871                    }
1872                }
1873            }
1874            if(fresh)
1875            {
1876                minHeat1 = ps;
1877                maxHeat1 = pc;
1878            }
1879            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
1880            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1881            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1882            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1883            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1884
1885
1886            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1887                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1888                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
1889                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
1890                    if (fresh) {
1891                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
1892                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
1893                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
1894                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
1895                    }
1896                }
1897            }
1898            if(fresh)
1899            {
1900                minHeat = qs;
1901                maxHeat = qc;
1902                minWet = ps;
1903                maxWet = pc;
1904            }
1905            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
1906            /*
1907            if(generateRivers) {
1908                if (fresh) {
1909                    addRivers();
1910                    riverData.connect8way().thin().thin();
1911                    lakeData.connect8way().thin();
1912                    partialRiverData.remake(riverData);
1913                    partialLakeData.remake(lakeData);
1914                } else {
1915                    partialRiverData.remake(riverData);
1916                    partialLakeData.remake(lakeData);
1917                    int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX >> zoom) - (width >> 2), 0), width),
1918                            sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY >> zoom) - (height >> 2), 0), height);
1919                    for (int i = 1; i <= zoom; i++) {
1920                        int stx2 = (startCacheX.get(i) - startCacheX.get(i - 1)) << (i - 1),
1921                                sty2 = (startCacheY.get(i) - startCacheY.get(i - 1)) << (i - 1);
1922                        //(zoomStartX >> zoom) - (width >> 1 + zoom), (zoomStartY >> zoom) - (height >> 1 + zoom)
1923
1924//                        Map is 200x100, GreasedRegions have that size too.
1925//                        Zoom 0 only allows 100,50 as the center, 0,0 as the corner
1926//                        Zoom 1 allows 100,50 to 300,150 as the center (x2 coordinates), 0,0 to 200,100 (refers to 200,100) as the corner
1927//                        Zoom 2 allows 100,50 to 700,350 as the center (x4 coordinates), 0,0 to 200,100 (refers to 600,300) as the corner
1928
1929
1930                        System.out.printf("zoomStartX: %d zoomStartY: %d, stx: %d sty: %d, stx2: %d, sty2: %d\n", zoomStartX, zoomStartY, stx, sty, stx2, sty2);
1931                        if ((i & 3) == 3) {
1932                            partialRiverData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way();
1933                            partialRiverData.or(workingData.remake(partialRiverData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.4));
1934                            partialLakeData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way();
1935                            partialLakeData.or(workingData.remake(partialLakeData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.55));
1936                        } else {
1937                            partialRiverData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way().thin();
1938                            partialRiverData.or(workingData.remake(partialRiverData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.5));
1939                            partialLakeData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way().thin();
1940                            partialLakeData.or(workingData.remake(partialLakeData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.7));
1941                        }
1942                        //stx = (width >> 1) ;//Math.min(Math.max(, 0), width);
1943                        //sty = (height >> 1);//Math.min(Math.max(, 0), height);
1944                    }
1945                    System.out.println();
1946                }
1947            }
1948            */
1949        }
1950    }
1951    /**
1952     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
1953     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
1954     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mollweide_projection">Mollweide projection</a>.
1955     * <a href="http://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/EllipseWorld.png" >Example map</a>.
1956     */
1957//     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/BBKrKjI.png" >Example map, showing ellipse shape</a>
1958     @Beta
1959    public static class EllipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1960        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1961        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1962        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1963                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1964                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1965
1966        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1967        public final double[][] xPositions,
1968                yPositions,
1969                zPositions;
1970        protected final int[] edges;
1971
1972
1973        /**
1974         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1975         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1976         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
1977         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1978         * If you were using {@link EllipticalMap#EllipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1979         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
1980         */
1981        public EllipticalMap() {
1982            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1983        }
1984
1985        /**
1986         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1987         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1988         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1989         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1990         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1991         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1992         *
1993         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1994         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1995         */
1996        public EllipticalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1997            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
1998        }
1999
2000        /**
2001         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2002         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2003         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2004         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2005         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2006         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2007         *
2008         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2009         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2010         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2011         */
2012        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2013            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2014        }
2015
2016        /**
2017         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2018         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2019         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2020         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2021         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2022         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2023         *
2024         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2025         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2026         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2027         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2028         */
2029        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2030            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2031        }
2032
2033        /**
2034         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2035         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2036         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2037         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2038         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2039         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
2040         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
2041         *
2042         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2043         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2044         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2045         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2046         */
2047        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2048            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2049        }
2050
2051        /**
2052         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2053         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2054         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
2055         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
2056         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2057         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2058         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2059         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2060         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2061         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2062         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2063         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2064         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2065         * that don't require zooming.
2066         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2067         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2068         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2069         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2070         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2071         */
2072        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2073            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2074            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2075            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2076            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2077            edges = new int[height << 1];
2078            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
2079            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
2080            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
2081            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
2082            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
2083        }
2084
2085        /**
2086         * Copies the EllipticalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2087         * be shared to Noise classes.
2088         * @param other an EllipticalMap to copy
2089         */
2090        public EllipticalMap(EllipticalMap other)
2091        {
2092            super(other);
2093            terrain = other.terrain;
2094            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
2095            heat = other.heat;
2096            moisture = other.moisture;
2097            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
2098            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
2099            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
2100            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
2101            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
2102            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
2103            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
2104            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
2105            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
2106            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
2107            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
2108        }
2109
2110        @Override
2111        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2112            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2113            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2114                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2115            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2116                return edges[y << 1];
2117            else return x;
2118        }
2119
2120        @Override
2121        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2122            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2123        }
2124
2125        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2126                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2127        {
2128            boolean fresh = false;
2129            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2130            {
2131                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2132                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2133                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2134                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2135                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2136                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2137                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2138                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2139                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2140                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2141                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2142                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2143                cacheA = stateA;
2144                cacheB = stateB;
2145                fresh = true;
2146            }
2147            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2148            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2149            int t;
2150
2151            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2152            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2153
2154            double p,
2155                    ps, pc,
2156                    qs, qc,
2157                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2158                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2159                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2160                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 0.99999 / Math.PI,
2161                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2162                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2163
2164            yPos = startY - ry;
2165            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2166                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2167                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2168                thy = thx * 2.0;
2169                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2170
2171                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2172                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2173
2174                boolean inSpace = true;
2175                xPos = startX;
2176                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2177                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2178                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2179                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2180                        inSpace = true;
2181                        continue;
2182                    }
2183                    if(inSpace)
2184                    {
2185                        inSpace = false;
2186                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2187                    }
2188                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2189                    th += centerLongitude;
2190                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2191                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2192                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2193                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2194                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2195                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2196                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2197                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2198                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2199                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2200                            , qs, seedB));
2201                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2202                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2203                            , seedC));
2204                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2205                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2206                    if(fresh) {
2207                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2208                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2209
2210                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2211                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2212
2213                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2214                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2215                    }
2216                }
2217                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2218                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2219
2220            }
2221            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2222                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2223                    hMod,
2224                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2225            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2226            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2227            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2228
2229            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2230                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
2231                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2232                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2233                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2234                    h = heightData[x][y];
2235                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2236                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2237                        continue;
2238                    }
2239                    else
2240                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2241                    hMod = 1.0;
2242                    switch (t) {
2243                        case 0:
2244                        case 1:
2245                        case 2:
2246                        case 3:
2247                            h = 0.4;
2248                            hMod = 0.2;
2249                            break;
2250                        case 6:
2251                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2252                            break;
2253                        case 7:
2254                            h *= -0.25;
2255                            break;
2256                        case 8:
2257                            h *= -0.4;
2258                            break;
2259                        default:
2260                            h *= 0.05;
2261                    }
2262                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2263                    if (fresh) {
2264                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2265                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2266                    }
2267                }
2268            }
2269            if(fresh)
2270            {
2271                minHeat1 = ps;
2272                maxHeat1 = pc;
2273            }
2274            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2275            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2276            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2277            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2278            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2279
2280
2281            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2282                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2283                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2284                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2285                    if (fresh) {
2286                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2287                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2288                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2289                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2290                    }
2291                }
2292            }
2293            if(fresh)
2294            {
2295                minHeat = qs;
2296                maxHeat = qc;
2297                minWet = ps;
2298                maxWet = pc;
2299            }
2300            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2301        }
2302    }
2303
2304    /**
2305     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing map (such as a map of Earth, which it can do by default). It
2306     * uses the Mollweide projection (an elliptical map projection, the same as what EllipticalMap uses) for both its
2307     * input and output; <a href="https://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/MimicWorld.png">an example can be seen here</a>,
2308     * imitating Earth using a 512x256 world map as a GreasedRegion for input.
2309     */
2310    public static class MimicMap extends EllipticalMap
2311    {
2312        public GreasedRegion earth;
2313        public GreasedRegion shallow;
2314        public GreasedRegion coast;
2315        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
2316        /**
2317         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should look like Earth using an elliptical projection
2318         * (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2319         * Always makes a 512x256 map.
2320         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2321         * If you were using {@link MimicMap#MimicMap(long, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2322         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
2323         */
2324        public MimicMap() {
2325            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL
2326                    , DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2327        }
2328
2329        /**
2330         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2331         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2332         * The initial seed is set to the same large long every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when
2333         * you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2334         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2335         *
2336         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2337         */
2338        public MimicMap(GreasedRegion toMimic) {
2339            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, toMimic,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
2340        }
2341
2342        /**
2343         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2344         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2345         * Takes an initial seed and the GreasedRegion containing land positions. The {@code initialSeed}
2346         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2347         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2348         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2349         *
2350         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2351         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2352         */
2353        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic) {
2354            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2355        }
2356
2357        /**
2358         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2359         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2360         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and a multiplier that affects the level
2361         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
2362         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2363         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2364         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2365         *
2366         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2367         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2368         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2369         */
2370        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, double octaveMultiplier) {
2371            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2372        }
2373
2374        /**
2375         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2376         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2377         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
2378         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
2379         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
2380         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
2381         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
2382         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
2383         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
2384         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2385         *
2386         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2387         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2388         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2389         */
2390        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2391            this(initialSeed, toMimic, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2392        }
2393
2394        /**
2395         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2396         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2397         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
2398         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
2399         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
2400         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2401         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2402         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2403         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2404         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2405         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2406         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2407         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2408         * that don't require zooming.
2409         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2410         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2411         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2412         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2413         */
2414        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2415            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
2416            earth = toMimic;
2417            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
2418            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
2419            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
2420        }
2421

2423         * Constructs a 512x256 elliptical world map that will use land forms with a similar shape to Earth.
2424         * @param initialSeed
2425         * @param noiseGenerator
2426         * @param octaveMultiplier
2427         */
2428        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier)
2429        {
2430            this(initialSeed,
2431                    GreasedRegion.decompress(LZSPlus.decompress(
2432                            "Ƥ䊅⑃л䣁ᩡġˤȰࠨ⑀ၰ䁶ިШဵ⃠䁠ႠʹƨЬࠨư්洤㘢啰ీᆕߊ偌怫本\u242AФd˄д.㖈่ը˨ըᠥࠨ䠤㐪䠼ࠬ栶ࠨଈڇ䎵兊Ƅ䊡ᒠ䒩Ԣ㤠ᬡ䴡䵒خ㐯簤ᐫ䐤ᐸŨϤሡ囁䓈䂔⁓ၯࠥ吥ᨡ儡⡖䁚⁊ဪ䠤⑥❺ᇕ粨䁓灜儯ُⓤϡǒᛤ䪆ୀᅔь掭稡缡ত䁲⁀Ұ\u0EA8䐢娠洩们䁔恄⍠⡨٤̭डಠ䉠㻀ᔲ䱍㐡ᨢࡕ\u089C䱢ⶀՐO廴∣℡䳕䂊⁊ှ栥ᦅي儠\u1CA0䣴⁐䠰ܨդϢü╏䑠䒤䉀མҫ于◧вႠ㥀ᑈȲl\u1CB4䄶ヘ䈩Ǉᅂ䈶┵℠湠㖰դʈ甤嫤利በڰl±ì\u2029䠩ন娼㠇砩\u175F䌬\u1AD9䱠ྰɔıT戽㑢£䁔ྸ䍂㣠ᑰඅ℠䥠∳ԋ棸玲䑂m䀣專*ơ噓Ǌေ㩈囤Ŵ䄈㤴ះ۸†䠨䫀纆ဣ䐣冸楚ಫ牴歀ઈǆ傠Ѩᴮ㨡䊠涻䢤ȑ÷ᚵР泡⡠௰ס嫼吠㪤ȃÿ\u202D䐪䅅㸵ᅨɶĲ䑀وւ夸‾⠪䈡ᑠ䉀ඈƀҨ㧃⌂¶䁼唨Ö䄈䨡ࢤŵì\u3130̈́Ƞɠ癀ۨã㺨㥓ⱂÏဳ᠊䈡㱠ీ塃\u1754㰭䪁ᜂ䂸⺑扬䈫䱥紤⣩䭲倩⊂Z怦ݠᩝᑡ*瀲⋒瘱Ƞ❠㨭㧳ᜩ䕕⫣瘈♨‿⨮㧌℧懢ච\u20C3ᗨƉ¿媖ഞ䛤\u08C9ᢅ䪤ᘬ¸䁰䠢礠䐿揠槌С喢ጫ™䈹ਠр㴬懯\u2028䰣惤ኰ悠ᄬǲだഘقɀ䋑Ɏ♡Wࠦ掲ฺ戠\u2E50ম峼\u2DA7掸㦨ŀ䁹༠墡ဣ⤠孠أő䉚Р㊠⿹䍂玳ɀ䀣ᴧ⁘‥ᐡ戶ႤÏ䁴\u0D50䲚Ⲫ嚆\u0E91㢙䠒ၠĈր婠煍㼱\u0B91^瀥˅Ɂᓺ䈸↞ቘ⛀䀻堮㔒怮吡カ孧䉊偦Ĳ兄ø䁴Ǧ䡂ࠃࠩ哃互⠠¡䂮吡䓠縸䝐䀨⠨⇆䦀䖹᪈ÃĈׄ⢤ᕶౄಣ⺉㊧₠ᥰ൘塠Ǹݡ〥浑\"倭ᔂ⓽Ƞ䃠≩䔠匄䬨ㆸ䆆\u1942ⱋ㻭ぷ‡簥碯唥\u08C6\u0A64梴㉄Ë䂇Ւ䔮३昳ࠡ㒠㚤溁崴䛭࿖暁:㠭ዀ戭୮ጣȤ慤掝ᦵŒያ\u20C1ᛶジ♱ႅ硧ࢶ㦰䐂憰ı¤ڨ⌅╳呬ᢌ戚怨Ⱕ\u20FFΣᄈ၃◶Ӑ\u0DE5㪁ᦠ\u0890ઢv‼曬渢瑨ᝤກ磒ᵡ婕沱2䐣厜䀿䠮䃸䪨ƿ\u20C8ʬõ䀻≒䱠ঘʱ≔憘㙀ĂÖ劦惐䀸䠤樞ȍ䄤•愢尳㸊ņຢ梠ްઃ串ṹ⑮檢\u0080怺⌁昵㣨䩗ᐩ䑁Ӗ䑱䛭ᵁС㚠䐰ƃpႨ³èᄤė䁴̔癤䜳㹢\u0FF7樆ࠢ傡栤櫐ಐ䐠䪠ዬႸ䀴㠨℠㧀ၤm堡ࠡठТ㢩ᑀۜ̏房㽋欦㛺㳘召‧℡\u08CCन㨤T࡚Ɛ‡樠ໟ恥₡祤䖄ᘦ峤߱嘰Ƴdʬ㷨䇆ᢐ䱀\u008D~ᰁ灕姆ᬗ䊟Ϣ器⋸ශᡮ㈚伩墵凑᪂穅ڼ\u2D28Å䁃唀ᵧၐ䑡+䠧ᢄഐᨻȖၣ⸩㈠⭙ᔢ\"〭愞ண澮ጪュ湠䆀央刁ડⲿや⻁\u242A檈ᜧ沋坘㗠籽⢰缱ؘȒ&堵ĠᏰࡡ䠴ᆊա籖!⬂屴Ѳ䁊䑖ס࠹䢑ᮣ砷凬‧删ิ㮜ᚠヴР棠⨡ᴾム㩩ნ楨аƍ䂤ٸ榣䅕ᰃ両ȁؠ猨㎸㉪恉ᡀⒹ䁒⬰灁Ƞ᳀ዉົ࡞◢⡔݀猊䄉䯐砻ƨހ䭓拝℥䁄ཾమ䢠ʤʸ⻤ჴࡁ#Э䢠ਔ۠㟣を@奟椨ވ\u08CF䏌⩶晠Ϻİ㏤U⁄‰┣㈡Ð硭ウੁ9䠧䂠\u0B84˄ⶃ傠ňթ吡⻈䡡⭹䆤Ꮓ慀ʞĊ䫡灀ȊŰဣ◠㘫ᗌ॰ᅓƯḃㅤɴ䀨∦䱜Դጯዤࠠ嶠ᛨu䂌䘪ᬮ᪴ˠฦ凞ᘂ牀͡→ᗑ㦖⁘ំ墉䞤ଫ婤݁࠺ુ屣㉇撱\u0CF4制児䉍・䶁ཏĠӐի䅩礠ᶨ\u0FE0ॸ儠‚\u0080殯䀳儢B㠠ᔨు屏䈠ጤڥ灋挲∥咂դ⩦↩୵䙏ᑐ\u1CB1ⵟ⋀‡璠斅䒱☤Ś̔亩䈒塁#⠧椐⇜沱Ġనӊᠹ焘༢W瀲\u0A78ဠ⊠ع䄞ᠫ㸢ℽჵࡤ֊⾼Ⴏᔁⶫ⊮婕ࡀϒÚ⥢倴皏ⵦ璌犰䅬ᣠ€碵Ġːऺ缨椴ၲ㞱櫂⺵⁁勠含めᣜ紧悌ྷ䱻\u0088᭄⹅ⓖ琸䢢ฐ㞹䄠ጨ\u0BA1瓣䂫Ⴂ爩㈠ႈႡኄ∠㏨Ẋ\u3040ΡȘဢ㬡䔱ଥΦ၀.łඪ≂ʬㄠ坤ۼ懱㖢Ѹ籤憗ၠ楑\u0BE2•䜠檷┶ᨧ瀫\u0560䀦ɦٴۘ䈢䠶ߍ娴℠ࣰฤ琫ᕎ\u0AB1ᇀ䄠  "

2437        /**
2438         * Copies the MimicMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2439         * be shared to Noise classes.
2440         * @param other a MimicMap to copy
2441         */
2442        public MimicMap(MimicMap other)
2443        {
2444            super(other);
2445            earth = other.earth.copy();
2446            earthOriginal = other.earthOriginal.copy();
2447            coast   = other.coast.copy();
2448            shallow = other.shallow.copy();
2449        }

2451
2452
2453        /**
2454         * Meant for making maps conform to the Mollweide (elliptical) projection that MimicMap uses.
2455         * @param rectangular A GreasedRegion where "on" represents land and "off" water, using any rectangular projection
2456         * @return a reprojected version of {@code rectangular} that uses an elliptical projection
2457         */
2458        public static GreasedRegion reprojectToElliptical(GreasedRegion rectangular) {
2459            int width = rectangular.width, height = rectangular.height;
2460            GreasedRegion t = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
2461            double yPos, xPos,
2462                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 0.99999 / Math.PI,
2463                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2464                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2465    
2466            yPos = -ry;
2467            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos++) {
2468                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2469                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2470                thy = thx * 2.0;
2471                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2472                xPos = 0;
2473                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos++) {
2474                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2475                    if (th >= -3.141592653589793 && th <= 3.141592653589793
2476                            && rectangular.contains((int) ((th + 1) * hw), (int) ((lat + 1) * ry))) {
2477                        t.insert(x, y);
2478                    }
2479                }
2480            }
2481            return t;
2482        }
2483
2484        @Override
2485        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2486            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2487            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2488                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2489            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2490                return edges[y << 1];
2491            else return x;
2492        }
2493
2494        @Override
2495        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2496            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2497        }
2498
2499        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2500                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2501        {
2502            boolean fresh = false;
2503            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2504            {
2505                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2506                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2507                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2508                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2509                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2510                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2511                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2512                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2513                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2514                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2515                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2516                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2517                cacheA = stateA;
2518                cacheB = stateB;
2519                fresh = true;
2520            }
2521            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2522            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2523            int t;
2524
2525            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
2526            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2527
2528            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
2529
2530            if(zoom > 0)
2531            {
2532                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
2533                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
2534                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
2535                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
2536                }
2537                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2538                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2539            }
2540            else
2541            {
2542                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
2543                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
2544            }
2545            double p,
2546                    ps, pc,
2547                    qs, qc,
2548                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2549                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2550                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2551                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 0.99999 / Math.PI,
2552                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2553                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2554            yPos = startY - ry;
2555            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2556
2557                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2558                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2559                thy = thx * 2.0;
2560                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2561
2562                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2563                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2564
2565                boolean inSpace = true;
2566                xPos = startX;
2567                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2568                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2569                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2570                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2571                        inSpace = true;
2572                        continue;
2573                    }
2574                    if(inSpace)
2575                    {
2576                        inSpace = false;
2577                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2578                    }
2579                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2580                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2581                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2582                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2583                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2584                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2585                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
2586                    {
2587                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2588                                ps, qs, seedA)) * 0.85;
2589                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
2590                            h += 0.05;
2591                        else
2592                            h += 0.15;
2593                    }
2594                    else
2595                    {
2596                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2597                                ps, qs, seedA)) * -0.9;
2598                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
2599                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
2600                        else
2601                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
2602                    }
2603                    heightData[x][y] = h;
2604                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2605                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2606                            , qs, seedB));
2607                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2608                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2609                            , seedC));
2610                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2611                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2612                    if(fresh) {
2613                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2614                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2615
2616                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2617                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2618
2619                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2620                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2621                    }
2622                }
2623                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2624                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2625
2626            }
2627            double heightDiff = 2.0 / (maxHeightActual - minHeightActual),
2628                    heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2629                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2630                    hMod,
2631                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / (halfHeight);
2632            double minHeightActual0 = minHeightActual;
2633            double maxHeightActual0 = maxHeightActual;
2634            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2635            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2636            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2637
2638            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2639                temp = Math.pow(Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half, 1.5);
2640                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2641                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2642                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2643//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
2644//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
2645//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
2646                    h = heightData[x][y];
2647                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2648                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2649                        continue;
2650                    }
2651                    else
2652                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2653                    hMod = 1.0;
2654                    switch (t) {
2655                        case 0:
2656                        case 1:
2657                        case 2:
2658                        case 3:
2659                            h = 0.4;
2660                            hMod = 0.2;
2661                            break;
2662                        case 6:
2663                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2664                            break;
2665                        case 7:
2666                            h *= -0.25;
2667                            break;
2668                        case 8:
2669                            h *= -0.4;
2670                            break;
2671                        default:
2672                            h *= 0.05;
2673                    }
2674                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2675                    if (fresh) {
2676                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2677                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2678                    }
2679                }
2680            }
2681            if(fresh)
2682            {
2683                minHeat1 = ps;
2684                maxHeat1 = pc;
2685            }
2686            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2687            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2688            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2689            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2690            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2691
2692
2693            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2694                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2695                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2696                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2697                    if (fresh) {
2698                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2699                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2700                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2701                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2702                    }
2703                }
2704            }
2705            if(fresh)
2706            {
2707                minHeat = qs;
2708                maxHeat = qc;
2709                minWet = ps;
2710                maxWet = pc;
2711            }
2712            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2713        }
2714
2715    }
2716    /**
2717     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
2718     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). This uses an
2719     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
2720     * the latitude always at the equator.
2721     * <a href="http://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/SpaceViewMap.png" >Example map, showing circular shape as if viewed
2722     * from afar</a>
2723     */
2724//         * <a href="https://tommyettinger.github.io/DorpBorx/worlds7/index.html">Example views of 50 planets</a>.
2725
2726    @Beta
2727    public static class SpaceViewMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
2728        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
2729        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
2730        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2731                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2732                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2733
2734        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
2735        public final double[][] xPositions,
2736                yPositions,
2737                zPositions;
2738        protected final int[] edges;
2739
2740        /**
2741         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2742         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2743         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
2744         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2745         * If you were using {@link SpaceViewMap#SpaceViewMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2746         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
2747         */
2748        public SpaceViewMap() {
2749            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2750        }
2751
2752        /**
2753         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2754         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2755         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
2756         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
2757         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2758         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2759         *
2760         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2761         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2762         */
2763        public SpaceViewMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2764            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
2765        }
2766
2767        /**
2768         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2769         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2770         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2771         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2772         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2773         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2774         *
2775         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2776         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2777         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2778         */
2779        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2780            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2781        }
2782
2783        /**
2784         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2785         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2786         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2787         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2788         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2789         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2790         *
2791         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2792         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2793         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2794         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2795         */
2796        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2797            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2798        }
2799
2800        /**
2801         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2802         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2803         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2804         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2805         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2806         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2807         *
2808         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2809         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2810         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2811         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2812         */
2813        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2814            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2815        }
2816
2817        /**
2818         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2819         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2820         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
2821         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
2822         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2823         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2824         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2825         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2826         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2827         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2828         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2829         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2830         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2831         * that don't require zooming.
2832         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2833         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2834         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2835         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2836         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2837         */
2838        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2839            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2840            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2841            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2842            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2843            edges = new int[height << 1];
2844            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
2845            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325, 0.475);
2846//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
2847//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25, 0.475);
2848            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
2849            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
2850            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
2851        }
2852
2853        /**
2854         * Copies the SpaceViewMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2855         * be shared to Noise classes.
2856         * @param other a SpaceViewMap to copy
2857         */
2858        public SpaceViewMap(SpaceViewMap other)
2859        {
2860            super(other);
