2861            terrain = other.terrain;
2862            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
2863            heat = other.heat;
2864            moisture = other.moisture;
2865            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
2866            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
2867            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
2868            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
2869            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
2870            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
2871            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
2872            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
2873            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
2874            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
2875            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
2876        }
2877        
2878        @Override
2879        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
2880            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2881            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
2882        }
2883
2884        @Override
2885        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2886            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2887        }
2888
2889        //private static final double root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0), inverseRoot2 = 1.0 / root2, halfInverseRoot2 = 0.5 / root2;
2890
2891        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2892                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2893        {
2894            boolean fresh = false;
2895            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2896            {
2897                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2898                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2899                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2900                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2901                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2902                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2903                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2904                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2905                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2906                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2907                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2908                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2909                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2910                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2911                cacheA = stateA;
2912                cacheB = stateB;
2913                fresh = true;
2914            }
2915            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2916            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2917            int t;
2918
2919            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2920            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2921
2922            double p,
2923                    ps, pc,
2924                    qs, qc,
2925                    h, temp, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
2926                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2927                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2928                    th, lon, lat, rho,
2929                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
2930                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
2931
2932            yPos = startY - ry;
2933            iyPos = yPos / ry;
2934            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
2935
2936                boolean inSpace = true;
2937                xPos = startX - rx;
2938                ixPos = xPos / rx;
2939                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
2940                    rho = Math.sqrt(ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
2941                    if(rho > 1.0) {
2942                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2943                        inSpace = true;
2944                        continue;
2945                    }
2946                    if(inSpace)
2947                    {
2948                        inSpace = false;
2949                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2950                    }
2951                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2952                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
2953                    lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
2954                    lon = centerLongitude + NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th));
2955
2956                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2957                    qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2958
2959                    pc = NumberTools.cos(lon) * qc;
2960                    ps = NumberTools.sin(lon) * qc;
2961
2962                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2963                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2964                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2965                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2966                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2967                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2968//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrain4D.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,
2969//                            (terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA)
2970//                                    + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC - seedB)) * 0.5,
2971//                            seedA) * landModifier);
2972                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2973                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2974                            , qs, seedB));
2975                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2976                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2977                            , seedC));
2978                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2979                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2980                    if(fresh) {
2981                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2982                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2983
2984                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2985                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2986
2987                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2988                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2989                    }
2990                }
2991                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2992                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2993
2994            }
2995            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2996                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2997                    hMod,
2998                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2999            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3000            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3001            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3002
3003            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3004                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3005                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3006                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3007                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3008                    h = heightData[x][y];
3009                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3010                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3011                        continue;
3012                    }
3013                    else
3014                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3015                    hMod = 1.0;
3016                    switch (t) {
3017                        case 0:
3018                        case 1:
3019                        case 2:
3020                        case 3:
3021                            h = 0.4;
3022                            hMod = 0.2;
3023                            break;
3024                        case 6:
3025                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3026                            break;
3027                        case 7:
3028                            h *= -0.25;
3029                            break;
3030                        case 8:
3031                            h *= -0.4;
3032                            break;
3033                        default:
3034                            h *= 0.05;
3035                    }
3036                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3037                    if (fresh) {
3038                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3039                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3040                    }
3041                }
3042            }
3043            if(fresh)
3044            {
3045                minHeat1 = ps;
3046                maxHeat1 = pc;
3047            }
3048            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3049            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3050            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3051            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3052            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3053
3054
3055            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3056                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3057                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3058                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3059                    if (fresh) {
3060                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3061                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3062                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3063                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3064                    }
3065                }
3066            }
3067            if(fresh)
3068            {
3069                minHeat = qs;
3070                maxHeat = qc;
3071                minWet = ps;
3072                maxWet = pc;
3073            }
3074            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3075        }
3076    }
3077    /**
3078     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape with a flat top
3079     * and bottom but near-circular sides. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3080     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3081     * distortion on the far left and far right edges of the map than EllipticalMap, but the flat top and bottom are
3082     * probably very distorted in a small area near the poles.
3083     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eckert_IV_projection">Eckert IV projection</a>.
3084     * <a href="https://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/RoundSideWorldMap.png">Example map</a>
3085     */
3086    @Beta
3087    public static class RoundSideMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3088        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3089        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3090        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3091                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3092                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3093
3094        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3095        public final double[][] xPositions,
3096                yPositions,
3097                zPositions;
3098        protected final int[] edges;
3099
3100
3101        /**
3102         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3103         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3104         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3105         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3106         * If you were using {@link RoundSideMap#RoundSideMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3107         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
3108         */
3109        public RoundSideMap() {
3110            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3111        }
3112
3113        /**
3114         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3115         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3116         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
3117         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
3118         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3119         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3120         *
3121         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3122         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3123         */
3124        public RoundSideMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3125            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
3126        }
3127
3128        /**
3129         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3130         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3131         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3132         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3133         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3134         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3135         *
3136         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3137         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3138         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3139         */
3140        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3141            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3142        }
3143
3144        /**
3145         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3146         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3147         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3148         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3149         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3150         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
3151         *
3152         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3153         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3154         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3155         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3156         */
3157        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
3158            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
3159        }
3160
3161        /**
3162         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3163         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3164         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3165         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3166         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3167         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3168         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}
3169         *
3170         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3171         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3172         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3173         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3174         */
3175        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
3176            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
3177        }
3178
3179        /**
3180         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3181         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3182         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3183         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3184         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3185         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3186         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3187         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3188         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3189         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3190         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3191         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3192         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3193         * that don't require zooming.
3194         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3195         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3196         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3197         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3198         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3199         */
3200        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
3201            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3202            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3203            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3204            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3205            edges = new int[height << 1];
3206            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3207            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3208//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
3209//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25);
3210            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3211            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3212            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3213        }
3214
3215        /**
3216         * Copies the RoundSideMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
3217         * be shared to Noise classes.
3218         * @param other a RoundSideMap to copy
3219         */
3220        public RoundSideMap(RoundSideMap other)
3221        {
3222            super(other);
3223            terrain = other.terrain;
3224            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
3225            heat = other.heat;
3226            moisture = other.moisture;
3227            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
3228            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
3229            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
3230            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
3231            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
3232            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
3233            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
3234            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
3235            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
3236            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
3237            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
3238        }
3239
3240        @Override
3241        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3242            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3243            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3244                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3245            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3246                return edges[y << 1];
3247            else return x;
3248        }
3249
3250        @Override
3251        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3252            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3253        }
3254
3255        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3256                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3257        {
3258            boolean fresh = false;
3259            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3260            {
3261                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3262                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3263                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3264                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3265                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3266                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3267                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3268                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3269                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3270                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3271                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3272                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3273                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3274                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3275                cacheA = stateA;
3276                cacheB = stateB;
3277                fresh = true;
3278            }
3279            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3280            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3281            int t;
3282
3283            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3284            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3285
3286            double p,
3287                    ps, pc,
3288                    qs, qc,
3289                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3290                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3291                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3292                    th, thb, thx, thy, lon, lat,
3293                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.326500428177002 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3294                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3295
3296            yPos = startY - ry;
3297            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3298                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3299                thb = NumberTools.asin(thy);
3300                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3301                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3302                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3303                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3304                lat = NumberTools.asin(qs);
3305
3306                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3307
3308                boolean inSpace = true;
3309                xPos = startX - hw;
3310                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3311                    th = lon * xPos;
3312                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3313                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3314                        inSpace = true;
3315                        continue;
3316                    }
3317                    if(inSpace)
3318                    {
3319                        inSpace = false;
3320                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3321                    }
3322                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3323                    th += centerLongitude;
3324                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3325                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3326                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3327                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3328                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3329                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3330                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3331                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3332                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3333                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
3334                            , qs, seedB));
3335                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3336                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3337                            , seedC));
3338                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3339                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3340                    if(fresh) {
3341                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3342                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3343
3344                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3345                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3346
3347                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3348                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3349                    }
3350                }
3351                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3352                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3353
3354            }
3355            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3356                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3357                    hMod,
3358                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3359            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3360            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3361            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3362
3363            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3364                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3365                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3366                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3367                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3368                    h = heightData[x][y];
3369                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3370                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3371                        continue;
3372                    }
3373                    else
3374                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3375                    hMod = 1.0;
3376                    switch (t) {
3377                        case 0:
3378                        case 1:
3379                        case 2:
3380                        case 3:
3381                            h = 0.4;
3382                            hMod = 0.2;
3383                            break;
3384                        case 6:
3385                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3386                            break;
3387                        case 7:
3388                            h *= -0.25;
3389                            break;
3390                        case 8:
3391                            h *= -0.4;
3392                            break;
3393                        default:
3394                            h *= 0.05;
3395                    }
3396                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3397                    if (fresh) {
3398                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3399                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3400                    }
3401                }
3402            }
3403            if(fresh)
3404            {
3405                minHeat1 = ps;
3406                maxHeat1 = pc;
3407            }
3408            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3409            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3410            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3411            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3412            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3413
3414
3415            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3416                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3417                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3418                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3419                    if (fresh) {
3420                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3421                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3422                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3423                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3424                    }
3425                }
3426            }
3427            if(fresh)
3428            {
3429                minHeat = qs;
3430                maxHeat = qc;
3431                minWet = ps;
3432                maxWet = pc;
3433            }
3434            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3435        }
3436    }
3437    /**
3438     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape that resembles a
3439     * mix part-way between an ellipse and a rectangle. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3440     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3441     * distortion around all the edges than the other maps here, especially when comparing the North and South poles
3442     * with RoundSideMap.
3443     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobler_hyperelliptical_projection">Tobler hyperelliptical projection</a>.
3444     * <a href="">Example map</a>
3445     */
3446    @Beta
3447    public static class HyperellipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3448        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3449        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3450                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3451                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3452
3453        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3454        public final double[][] xPositions,
3455                yPositions,
3456                zPositions;
3457        protected final int[] edges;
3458        private final double alpha, kappa, epsilon;
3459        private final double[] Z;
3460
3461
3462        /**
3463         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3464         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3465         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3466         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3467         * If you were using {@link HyperellipticalMap#HyperellipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3468         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
3469         * <a href="http://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/HyperellipseWorld.png" >Example map, showing special shape</a>
3470         */
3471        public HyperellipticalMap() {
3472            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3473        }
3474
3475        /**
3476         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3477         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3478         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
3479         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
3480         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3481         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3482         *
3483         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3484         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3485         */
3486        public HyperellipticalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3487            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
3488        }
3489
3490        /**
3491         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3492         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3493         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3494         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3495         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3496         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3497         *
3498         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3499         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3500         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3501         */
3502        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3503            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3504        }
3505
3506        /**
3507         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3508         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3509         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3510         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3511         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3512         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
3513         *
3514         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3515         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3516         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3517         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3518         */
3519        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
3520            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
3521        }
3522
3523        /**
3524         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3525         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3526         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3527         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3528         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3529         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3530         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
3531         *
3532         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3533         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3534         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3535         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3536         */
3537        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
3538            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
3539        }
3540
3541        /**
3542         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3543         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3544         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3545         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3546         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3547         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3548         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3549         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3550         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3551         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3552         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3553         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3554         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3555         * that don't require zooming.
3556         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3557         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3558         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3559         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3560         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3561         */
3562        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier){
3563            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier, 0.0625, 2.5);
3564        }
3565
3566        /**
3567         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3568         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3569         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3570         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3571         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3572         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3573         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3574         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3575         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3576         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3577         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3578         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3579         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3580         * that don't require zooming.
3581         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3582         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3583         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3584         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3585         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3586         * @param alpha one of the Tobler parameters;  0.0625 is the default and this can range from 0.0 to 1.0 at least
3587         * @param kappa one of the Tobler parameters; 2.5 is the default but 2.0-5.0 range values are also often used
3588         */
3589        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator,
3590                                  double octaveMultiplier, double alpha, double kappa){
3591            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3592            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3593            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3594            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3595            edges = new int[height << 1];
3596            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3597            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3598            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3599            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3600            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3601            this.alpha = alpha;
3602            this.kappa = kappa;
3603            this.Z = new double[height << 2];
3604            this.epsilon = ProjectionTools.simpsonIntegrateHyperellipse(0.0, 1.0, 0.25 / height, kappa);
3605            ProjectionTools.simpsonODESolveHyperellipse(1, this.Z, 0.25 / height, alpha, kappa, epsilon);
3606        }
3607        /**
3608         * Copies the HyperellipticalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
3609         * be shared to Noise classes.
3610         * @param other a HyperellipticalMap to copy
3611         */
3612        public HyperellipticalMap(HyperellipticalMap other)
3613        {
3614            super(other);
3615            terrain = other.terrain;
3616            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
3617            heat = other.heat;
3618            moisture = other.moisture;
3619            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
3620            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
3621            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
3622            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
3623            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
3624            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
3625            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
3626            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
3627            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
3628            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
3629            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
3630            alpha = other.alpha;
3631            kappa = other.kappa;
3632            epsilon = other.epsilon;
3633            Z = Arrays.copyOf(other.Z, other.Z.length);
3634        }
3635
3636
3637        @Override
3638        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3639            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3640            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3641                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3642            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3643                return edges[y << 1];
3644            else return x;
3645        }
3646
3647        @Override
3648        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3649            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3650        }
3651
3652        /**
3653         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
3654         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
3655         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
3656         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
3657         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
3658         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
3659         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
3660         *
3661         * @param latitude  the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
3662         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
3663         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
3664         */
3665        @Override
3666        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
3667            final double z0 = Math.abs(NumberTools.sin(latitude));
3668            final int i = Arrays.binarySearch(Z, z0);
3669            final double y;
3670            if (i >= 0)
3671                y = i/(Z.length-1.);
3672            else if (-i-1 >= Z.length)
3673                y = Z[Z.length-1];
3674            else
3675                y = ((z0-Z[-i-2])/(Z[-i-1]-Z[-i-2]) + (-i-2))/(Z.length-1.);
3676            final int xx = (int)(((longitude - getCenterLongitude() + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*Math.pow(1 - Math.pow(Math.abs(y),kappa), 1/kappa)) + 0.5);
3677            final int yy = (int)(y * Math.signum(latitude) * height * 0.5 + 0.5);
3678            return Coord.get(wrapX(xx, yy), wrapY(xx, yy));
3679        }
3680
3681        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3682                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3683        {
3684            boolean fresh = false;
3685            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3686            {
3687                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3688                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3689                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3690                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3691                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3692                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3693                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3694                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3695                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3696                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3697                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3698                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3699                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3700                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3701                cacheA = stateA;
3702                cacheB = stateB;
3703                fresh = true;
3704            }
3705            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3706            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3707            int t;
3708
3709            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3710            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3711
3712            double p,
3713                    ps, pc,
3714                    qs, qc,
3715                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3716                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3717                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3718                    th, lon,
3719                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = Math.PI / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3720                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3721
3722            yPos = startY - ry;
3723            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3724//                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3725//                thb = asin(thy);
3726//                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3727//                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3728//                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3729//                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3730//                lat = asin(qs);
3731//
3732//                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3733
3734                lon = NumberTools.asin(Z[(int)(0.5 + Math.abs(yPos*iry)*(Z.length-1))])*Math.signum(yPos);
3735                qs = NumberTools.sin(lon);
3736                qc = NumberTools.cos(lon);
3737
3738                boolean inSpace = true;
3739                xPos = startX - hw;
3740                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3741                    //th = lon * xPos;
3742                    th = xPos * irx / Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*ProjectionTools.hyperellipse(yPos * iry, kappa));
3743                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3744                        //if(th < -2.0 || th > 2.0) {
3745                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3746                        inSpace = true;
3747                        continue;
3748                    }
3749                    if(inSpace)
3750                    {
3751                        inSpace = false;
3752                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3753                    }
3754                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3755                    th += centerLongitude;
3756                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3757                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3758                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3759                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3760                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3761                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3762                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3763                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3764                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3765                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB + seedC)
3766                            , qs, seedB));
3767                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3768                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3769                            , seedC));
3770                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3771                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3772                    if(fresh) {
3773                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3774                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3775
3776                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3777                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3778
3779                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3780                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3781                    }
3782                }
3783                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3784                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3785
3786            }
3787            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3788                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3789                    hMod,
3790                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3791            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3792            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3793            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3794
3795            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3796                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3797                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3798                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3799                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3800                    h = heightData[x][y];
3801                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3802                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3803                        continue;
3804                    }
3805                    else
3806                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3807                    hMod = 1.0;
3808                    switch (t) {
3809                        case 0:
3810                        case 1:
3811                        case 2:
3812                        case 3:
3813                            h = 0.4;
3814                            hMod = 0.2;
3815                            break;
3816                        case 6:
3817                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3818                            break;
3819                        case 7:
3820                            h *= -0.25;
3821                            break;
3822                        case 8:
3823                            h *= -0.4;
3824                            break;
3825                        default:
3826                            h *= 0.05;
3827                    }
3828                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3829                    if (fresh) {
3830                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3831                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3832                    }
3833                }
3834            }
3835            if(fresh)
3836            {
3837                minHeat1 = ps;
3838                maxHeat1 = pc;
3839            }
3840            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3841            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3842            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3843            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3844            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3845
3846
3847            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3848                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3849                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3850                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3851                    if (fresh) {
3852                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3853                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3854                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3855                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3856                    }
3857                }
3858            }
3859            if(fresh)
3860            {
3861                minHeat = qs;
3862                maxHeat = qc;
3863                minWet = ps;
3864                maxWet = pc;
3865            }
3866            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3867        }
3868    }
3869
3870    /**
3871     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
3872     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
3873     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_projection">Hammer projection</a>, so the latitude
3874     * lines are curved instead of flat. The Mollweide projection that {@link EllipticalMap} uses has flat lines, but
3875     * the two projection are otherwise very similar, and are both equal-area (Hammer tends to have less significant
3876     * distortion around the edges, but the curvature of the latitude lines can be hard to visualize).
3877     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nmN6lMK.gifv">Preview image link of a world rotating</a>.
3878     */
3879    @Beta
3880    public static class EllipticalHammerMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3881        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3882        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3883        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3884                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3885                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3886
3887        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3888        public final double[][] xPositions,
3889                yPositions,
3890                zPositions;
3891        protected final int[] edges;
3892
3893
3894        /**
3895         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3896         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3897         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3898         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3899         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3900         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3901         * If you were using {@link EllipticalHammerMap#EllipticalHammerMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3902         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
3903         */
3904        public EllipticalHammerMap() {
3905            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3906        }
3907
3908        /**
3909         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3910         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3911         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3912         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3913         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
3914         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
3915         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3916         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3917         *
3918         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3919         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3920         */
3921        public EllipticalHammerMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3922            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
3923        }
3924
3925        /**
3926         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3927         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3928         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3929         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3930         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3931         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3932         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3933         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3934         *
3935         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3936         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3937         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3938         */
3939        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3940            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3941        }
3942
3943        /**
3944         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3945         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3946         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3947         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3948         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3949         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3950         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3951         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
3952         *
3953         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3954         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3955         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3956         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3957         */
3958        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
3959            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
3960        }
3961
3962        /**
3963         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3964         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3965         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3966         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3967         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3968         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3969         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3970         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3971         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
3972         *
3973         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3974         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3975         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3976         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3977         */
3978        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
3979            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
3980        }
3981
3982        /**
3983         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3984         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3985         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3986         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3987         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3988         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3989         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3990         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3991         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3992         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3993         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3994         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3995         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3996         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3997         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3998         * that don't require zooming.
3999         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4000         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4001         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4002         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4003         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4004         */
4005        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4006            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4007            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4008            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4009            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4010            edges = new int[height << 1];
4011            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
4012            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4013//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
4014//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25);
4015            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
4016            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
4017            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
4018        }
4019
4020        /**
4021         * Copies the EllipticalHammerMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4022         * be shared to Noise classes.
4023         * @param other an EllipticalHammerMap to copy
4024         */
4025        public EllipticalHammerMap(EllipticalHammerMap other)
4026        {
4027            super(other);
4028            terrain = other.terrain;
4029            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
4030            heat = other.heat;
4031            moisture = other.moisture;
4032            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
4033            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4034            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4035            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4036            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4037            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4038            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4039            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4040            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4041            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4042            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4043        }
4044
4045        @Override
4046        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
4047            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4048            if(x < edges[y << 1])
4049                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
4050            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
4051                return edges[y << 1];
4052            else return x;
4053        }
4054
4055        @Override
4056        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4057            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4058        }
4059
4060        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4061                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4062        {
4063            boolean fresh = false;
4064            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4065            {
4066                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4067                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4068                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4069                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4070                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4071                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4072                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4073                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4074                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4075                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4076                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4077                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4078                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4079                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4080                cacheA = stateA;
4081                cacheB = stateB;
4082                fresh = true;
4083            }
4084            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4085            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4086            int t;
4087
4088            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
4089            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4090
4091            double p,
4092                    ps, pc,
4093                    qs, qc,
4094                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
4095                    z, th, lon, lat,
4096                    rx = width * 0.5, hw = width * 0.5, root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0),
4097                    irx = 1.0 / rx, iry = 2.0 / (double) height,
4098                    xAdj, yAdj,
4099                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)(width),
4100                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)(height);
4101
4102            yPos = (startY - height * 0.5);
4103            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4104                boolean inSpace = true;
4105                yAdj = yPos * iry;
4106                xPos = (startX - hw);
4107                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4108                    xAdj = xPos * irx;
4109                    z = Math.sqrt(1.0 - 0.5 * xAdj * xAdj - 0.5 * yAdj * yAdj);
4110                    th = z * yAdj * root2;
4111                    lon = 2.0 * NumberTools.atan2((2.0 * z * z - 1.0), (z * xAdj * root2));
4112                    if(th != th || lon < 0.0) {
4113                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
4114                        inSpace = true;
4115                        continue;
4116                    }
4117                    lat = NumberTools.asin(th);
4118                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
4119                    qs = th;
4120                    th = Math.PI - lon + centerLongitude;
4121                    if(inSpace)
4122                    {
4123                        inSpace = false;
4124                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4125                    }
4126                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4127                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
4128                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
4129                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
4130                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
4131                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4132                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
4133                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4134                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4135                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
4136                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
4137                            , qs, seedB));
4138                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
4139                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
4140                            , seedC));
4141                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4142                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4143                    if(fresh) {
4144                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4145                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4146
4147                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4148                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4149
4150                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4151                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4152                    }
4153                }
4154                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4155                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4156
4157            }
4158            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4159                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4160                    hMod,
4161                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
4162            yPos = startY + i_uh;
4163            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4164            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4165
4166            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4167                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
4168                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
4169                temp = 2.2 - temp;
4170                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4171                    h = heightData[x][y];
4172                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
4173                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4174                        continue;
4175                    }
4176                    else
4177                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4178                    hMod = 1.0;
4179                    switch (t) {
4180                        case 0:
4181                        case 1:
4182                        case 2:
4183                        case 3:
4184                            h = 0.4;
4185                            hMod = 0.2;
4186                            break;
4187                        case 6:
4188                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4189                            break;
4190                        case 7:
4191                            h *= -0.25;
4192                            break;
4193                        case 8:
4194                            h *= -0.4;
4195                            break;
4196                        default:
4197                            h *= 0.05;
4198                    }
4199                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
4200                    if (fresh) {
4201                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4202                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4203                    }
4204                }
4205            }
4206            if(fresh)
4207            {
4208                minHeat1 = ps;
4209                maxHeat1 = pc;
4210            }
4211            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4212            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4213            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4214            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4215            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4216
4217
4218            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4219                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4220                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
