4221                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4222                    if (fresh) {
4223                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4224                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4225                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4226                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4227                    }
4228                }
4229            }
4230            if(fresh)
4231            {
4232                minHeat = qs;
4233                maxHeat = qc;
4234                minWet = ps;
4235                maxWet = pc;
4236            }
4237            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4238        }
4239    }
4240
4241
4242
4243    /**
4244     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
4245     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). It should
4246     * look as a world would when viewed from space, and implements rotation differently to allow the planet to be
4247     * rotated without recalculating all the data, though it cannot zoom. Note that calling
4248     * {@link #setCenterLongitude(double)} does a lot more work than in other classes, but less than fully calling
4249     * {@link #generate()} in those classes, since it doesn't remake the map data at a slightly different rotation and
4250     * instead keeps a single map in use the whole time, using sections of it. This uses an
4251     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
4252     * the latitude always at the equator; the internal map is stored as a {@link SphereMap}, which uses a
4253     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylindrical_equal-area_projection#Discussion">cylindrical equal-area
4254     * projection</a>, specifically the Smyth equal-surface projection.
4255     * <br>
4256     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WNa5nQ1.gifv">Example view of a planet rotating</a>.
4257     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/NV5IMd6.gifv">Another example</a>.
4258     */
4259    @Beta
4260    public static class RotatingSpaceMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4261        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4262                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4263                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4264
4265        public final double[][] xPositions,
4266                yPositions,
4267                zPositions;
4268        protected final int[] edges;
4269        public final SphereMap storedMap;
4270        /**
4271         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4272         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4273         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
4274         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4275         * If you were using {@link RotatingSpaceMap#RotatingSpaceMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
4276         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4277         */
4278        public RotatingSpaceMap() {
4279            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4280        }
4281
4282        /**
4283         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4284         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4285         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4286         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4287         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4288         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4289         *
4290         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4291         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4292         */
4293        public RotatingSpaceMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4294            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4295        }
4296
4297        /**
4298         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4299         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4300         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4301         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4302         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4303         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4304         *
4305         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4306         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4307         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4308         */
4309        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4310            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4311        }
4312
4313        /**
4314         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4315         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4316         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4317         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4318         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4319         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4320         *
4321         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4322         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4323         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4324         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4325         */
4326        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
4327            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4328        }
4329
4330        /**
4331         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4332         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4333         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4334         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4335         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4336         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4337         *
4338         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4339         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4340         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4341         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4342         */
4343        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
4344            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4345        }
4346
4347        /**
4348         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4349         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4350         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4351         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4352         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4353         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4354         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4355         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4356         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4357         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4358         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4359         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4360         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4361         * that don't require zooming.
4362         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4363         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4364         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4365         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4366         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4367         */
4368        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4369            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4370            xPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4371            yPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4372            zPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4373            edges = new int[height << 1];
4374            storedMap = new SphereMap(initialSeed, mapWidth << 1, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4375        }
4376
4377        /**
4378         * Copies the RotatingSpaceMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4379         * be shared to Noise classes.
4380         * @param other a RotatingSpaceMap to copy
4381         */
4382        public RotatingSpaceMap(RotatingSpaceMap other)
4383        {
4384            super(other);
4385            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4386            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4387            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4388            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4389            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4390            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4391            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4392            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4393            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4394            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4395            storedMap = new SphereMap(other.storedMap);
4396        }
4397
4398
4399        @Override
4400        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
4401            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4402            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
4403        }
4404
4405        @Override
4406        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4407            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4408        }
4409
4410        @Override
4411        public void setCenterLongitude(double centerLongitude) {
4412            super.setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4413            int ax, ay;
4414            double
4415                    ps, pc,
4416                    qs, qc,
4417                    h, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
4418                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
4419                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
4420                    th, lon, lat, rho,
4421                    i_pi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
4422                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
4423                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
4424
4425            yPos = startY - ry;
4426            iyPos = yPos / ry;
4427            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
4428                boolean inSpace = true;
4429                xPos = startX - rx;
4430                ixPos = xPos / rx;
4431                lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
4432                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
4433                    rho = (ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
4434                    if(rho > 1.0) {
4435                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4436                        inSpace = true;
4437                        continue;
4438                    }
4439                    rho = Math.sqrt(rho);
4440                    if(inSpace)
4441                    {
4442                        inSpace = false;
4443                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4444                    }
4445                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4446                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
4447                    lon = removeExcess((centerLongitude + (NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th)))) * 0.5);
4448
4449                    qs = lat * 0.6366197723675814;
4450                    qc = qs + 1.0;
4451                    int sf = (qs >= 0.0 ? (int) qs : (int) qs - 1) & -2;
4452                    int cf = (qc >= 0.0 ? (int) qc : (int) qc - 1) & -2;
4453                    qs -= sf;
4454                    qc -= cf;
4455                    qs *= 2.0 - qs;
4456                    qc *= 2.0 - qc;
4457                    qs = qs * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qs) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4458                    qc = qc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4459
4460
4461                    ps = lon * 0.6366197723675814;
4462                    pc = ps + 1.0;
4463                    sf = (ps >= 0.0 ? (int) ps : (int) ps - 1) & -2;
4464                    cf = (pc >= 0.0 ? (int) pc : (int) pc - 1) & -2;
4465                    ps -= sf;
4466                    pc -= cf;
4467                    ps *= 2.0 - ps;
4468                    pc *= 2.0 - pc;
4469                    ps = ps * (-0.775 - 0.225 * ps) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4470                    pc = pc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * pc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4471
4472                    ax = (int)((lon * i_pi + 1.0) * width);
4473                    ay = (int)((qs + 1.0) * ry);
4474                    
4475//                    // Hammer projection, not an inverse projection like we usually use
4476//                    z = 1.0 / Math.sqrt(1 + qc * NumberTools.cos(lon * 0.5));
4477//                    ax = (int)((qc * NumberTools.sin(lon * 0.5) * z + 1.0) * width);
4478//                    ay = (int)((qs * z + 1.0) * height * 0.5);
4479
4480                    if(ax >= storedMap.width || ax < 0 || ay >= storedMap.height || ay < 0)
4481                    {
4482                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4483                        continue;
4484                    }
4485                    if(storedMap.heightCodeData[ax][ay] >= 1000) // for the seam we get when looping around
4486                    {
4487                        ay = storedMap.wrapY(ax, ay);
4488                        ax = storedMap.wrapX(ax, ay);
4489                    }
4490
4491                    xPositions[x][y] = pc * qc;
4492                    yPositions[x][y] = ps * qc;
4493                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4494
4495                    heightData[x][y] = h = storedMap.heightData[ax][ay];
4496                    heightCodeData[x][y] = codeHeight(h);
4497                    heatData[x][y] = storedMap.heatData[ax][ay];
4498                    moistureData[x][y] = storedMap.moistureData[ax][ay];
4499
4500                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4501                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4502                }
4503                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4504                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4505            }
4506
4507        }
4508
4509        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4510                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4511        {
4512            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB)// || landMod != storedMap.landModifier || coolMod != storedMap.coolingModifier)
4513            {
4514                storedMap.regenerate(0, 0, width << 1, height, landMod, heatMod, stateA, stateB);
4515                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4516                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4517
4518                minHeight = storedMap.minHeight;
4519                maxHeight = storedMap.maxHeight;
4520
4521                minHeat0 = storedMap.minHeat0;
4522                maxHeat0 = storedMap.maxHeat0;
4523
4524                minHeat1 = storedMap.minHeat1;
4525                maxHeat1 = storedMap.maxHeat1;
4526
4527                minWet0 = storedMap.minWet0;
4528                maxWet0 = storedMap.maxWet0;
4529
4530                minHeat = storedMap.minHeat;
4531                maxHeat = storedMap.maxHeat;
4532
4533                minWet = storedMap.minWet;
4534                maxWet = storedMap.maxWet;
4535
4536                cacheA = stateA;
4537                cacheB = stateB;
4538            }
4539            setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4540            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4541        }
4542    }
4543    /**
4544     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that does no projection of the map, as if the area were
4545     * completely flat or small enough that curvature is impossible to see. This also does not change heat levels at the
4546     * far north and south regions of the map, since it is meant for areas that are all about the same heat level.
4547     * <a href="http://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/LocalMap.png" >Example map, showing lack of polar ice</a>
4548     */
4549    public static class LocalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4550        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
4551        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
4552        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4553                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4554                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4555
4556        public final Noise.Ridged2D terrain, otherRidged;
4557        public final Noise.InverseLayered2D heat, moisture, terrainLayered;
4558        public final double[][] xPositions,
4559                yPositions,
4560                zPositions;
4561
4562
4563        /**
4564         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4565         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4566         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4567         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
4568         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4569         * If you were using {@link LocalMap#LocalMap(long, int, int, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4570         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4571         */
4572        public LocalMap() {
4573            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4574        }
4575
4576        /**
4577         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4578         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4579         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4580         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4581         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4582         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4583         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4584         *
4585         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4586         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4587         */
4588        public LocalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4589            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
4590        }
4591
4592        /**
4593         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4594         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4595         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4596         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4597         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4598         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4599         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4600         *
4601         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4602         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4603         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4604         */
4605        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4606            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4607        }
4608
4609        /**
4610         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4611         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4612         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4613         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4614         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4615         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4616         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4617         *
4618         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4619         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4620         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4621         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4622         */
4623        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
4624            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4625        }
4626
4627        /**
4628         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4629         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4630         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4631         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4632         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4633         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4634         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4635         *
4636         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4637         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4638         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4639         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4640         */
4641        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator) {
4642            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4643        }
4644
4645        /**
4646         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4647         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4648         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4649         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4650         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4651         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4652         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4653         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4654         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4655         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4656         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4657         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4658         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4659         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4660         * that don't require zooming.
4661         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4662         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4663         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4664         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
4665         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4666         */
4667        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4668            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4669            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4670            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4671            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4672
4673            terrain = new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
4674            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4675            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
4676            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
4677            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
4678        }
4679
4680        /**
4681         * Copies the LocalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4682         * be shared to Noise classes.
4683         * @param other a LocalMap to copy
4684         */
4685        public LocalMap(LocalMap other)
4686        {
4687            super(other);
4688            terrain = other.terrain;
4689            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
4690            heat = other.heat;
4691            moisture = other.moisture;
4692            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
4693            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4694            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4695            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4696            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4697            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4698            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4699            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4700            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4701            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4702        }
4703
4704        @Override
4705        public int wrapX(final int x, final int y)  {
4706            return Math.max(0, Math.min(x, width - 1));
4707        }
4708
4709        @Override
4710        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4711            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4712        }
4713        
4714        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4715                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4716        {
4717            boolean fresh = false;
4718            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4719            {
4720                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4721                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4722                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4723                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4724                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4725                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4726                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4727                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4728                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4729                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4730                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4731                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4732                cacheA = stateA;
4733                cacheB = stateB;
4734                fresh = true;
4735            }
4736            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4737            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4738            int t;
4739
4740            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4741            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4742
4743            double p,
4744                    ps, pc,
4745                    qs, qc,
4746                    h, temp,
4747                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),  ii = Math.max(i_w, i_h),
4748                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * ii, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * ii, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
4749            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) { 
4750                xPos = startX * i_w;
4751                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4752                    xPositions[x][y] = xPos;
4753                    yPositions[x][y] = yPos;
4754                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
4755                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4756                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4757                            yPos, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4758                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
4759                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
4760                            seedB));
4761                    temp = otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
4762                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
4763
4764                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4765                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4766                    if(fresh) {
4767                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4768                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4769
4770                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4771                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4772
4773                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4774                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4775                    }
4776                }
4777                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4778                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4779
4780            }
4781            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4782                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4783                    hMod;
4784            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
4785            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4786            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4787
4788            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4789                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4790                    h = heightData[x][y];
4791                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4792                    hMod = 1.0;
4793                    switch (t) {
4794                        case 0:
4795                        case 1:
4796                        case 2:
4797                        case 3:
4798                            h = 0.4;
4799                            hMod = 0.2;
4800                            break;
4801                        case 6:
4802                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4803                            break;
4804                        case 7:
4805                            h *= -0.25;
4806                            break;
4807                        case 8:
4808                            h *= -0.4;
4809                            break;
4810                        default:
4811                            h *= 0.05;
4812                    }
4813                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
4814                    if (fresh) {
4815                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4816                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4817                    }
4818                }
4819            }
4820            if(fresh)
4821            {
4822                minHeat1 = ps;
4823                maxHeat1 = pc;
4824            }
4825            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4826            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4827            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4828            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4829            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4830
4831
4832            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4833                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4834                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4835                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4836                    if (fresh) {
4837                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4838                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4839                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4840                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4841                    }
4842                }
4843            }
4844            if(fresh)
4845            {
4846                minHeat = qs;
4847                maxHeat = qc;
4848                minWet = ps;
4849                maxWet = pc;
4850            }
4851            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4852        }
4853    }
4854
4855    /**
4856     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing local map (such as a map of Australia, which it can do by
4857     * default), without applying any projection or changing heat levels in the polar regions or equator.
4858     * <a href="http://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/LocalMimicMap.png" >Example map, showing a variant on Australia</a>
4859     */
4860    public static class LocalMimicMap extends LocalMap
4861    {
4862        public GreasedRegion earth;
4863        public GreasedRegion shallow;
4864        public GreasedRegion coast;
4865        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
4866        /**
4867         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should look like Australia, without projecting the
4868         * land positions or changing heat by latitude. Always makes a 256x256 map.
4869         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4870         * If you were using {@link LocalMimicMap#LocalMimicMap(long, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4871         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4872         */
4873        public LocalMimicMap() {
4874            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL
4875                    , DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4876        }
4877
4878        /**
4879         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4880         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4881         * The initial seed is set to the same large long every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when
4882         * you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4883         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4884         *
4885         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4886         */
4887        public LocalMimicMap(GreasedRegion toMimic) {
4888            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, toMimic,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
4889        }
4890
4891        /**
4892         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4893         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4894         * Takes an initial seed and the GreasedRegion containing land positions. The {@code initialSeed}
4895         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4896         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4897         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4898         *
4899         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4900         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4901         */
4902        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic) {
4903            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4904        }
4905
4906        /**
4907         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4908         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4909         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and a multiplier that affects the level
4910         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
4911         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4912         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4913         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4914         *
4915         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4916         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4917         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4918         */
4919        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, double octaveMultiplier) {
4920            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4921        }
4922
4923        /**
4924         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4925         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4926         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
4927         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
4928         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
4929         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
4930         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
4931         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
4932         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
4933         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4934         *
4935         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4936         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4937         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4938         */
4939        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator) {
4940            this(initialSeed, toMimic, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4941        }
4942
4943        /**
4944         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4945         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
4946         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
4947         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
4948         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
4949         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4950         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4951         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4952         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4953         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4954         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4955         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4956         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4957         * that don't require zooming.
4958         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4959         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4960         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4961         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4962         */
4963        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4964            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4965            earth = toMimic;
4966            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
4967            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
4968            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
4969        }
4970
4971        /**
4972         * Constructs a 256x256 unprojected local map that will use land forms with a similar shape to Australia.
4973         * @param initialSeed
4974         * @param noiseGenerator
4975         * @param octaveMultiplier
4976         */
4977        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier)
4978        {
4979            this(initialSeed,
4980                    GreasedRegion.decompress(LZSPlus.decompress(
4981                            "Ƥ䒅⒐᮰囨䈢ħ䐤࠰ࠨ•Ⱙအ䎢ŘňÆ䴣ȢؤF䭠゠ᔤ∠偰ഀ\u0560₠ኼܨā᭮笁\u242AЦᇅ扰रࠦ吠䠪ࠦ䠧娮⠬䠬❁Ềក\u1CAA͠敠ἒ慽Ê䄄洡儠䋻䨡㈠䙬坈མŨྈ䞻䛊哚晪⁞倰h·䡂Ļæ抂㴢္\u082E搧䈠ᇩᒠ᩠ɀ༨ʨڤʃ奲ࢠ፠ᆙả䝆䮳りĩ(ॠી᧰྄e॑ᤙ䒠剠⁌ဥࠩФΝ䂂⢴ᑠ㺀ᢣ䗨dBqÚ扜冢\u0FE5\u0A62䐠劣ေ¯䂍䞀ၰ\u0E67ᐓ〈ᄠ塠Ѡ̀ာ⠤ᡤŒęጓ憒‱〿䌳℔ᐼ䊢⁚䤿ӣ◚㙀\u0C74Ӹ抠⣀ĨǊǸ䁃း₺Ý䂁ᜤ䢑V⁄樫焠\u0A60\u2E78⎲Ĉ䁎勯戡璠悈ᠥ嘡⩩‰ನ檨㡕䶪၁@恑ࠣ䘣ࢠᅀᡎ劰桠Өॢಸ熛փࢸ䀹ఽ䅠勖ਰ۴̄ጺಢ䈠ᙠᨭ\u2FE0焠Ӡܼ䇂䒠ᯀԨĠ愜᪅䦥㶐ୀ\u09C5Ƣ*䂕ॹ∠咠р\u0604У無~⁆Г椠痠\u1CA9Ⱓס㩖ᝋ司楠२ญⳘ䬣汤ǿã㱩ᖷ掠Àݒ㑁c‾䮴,\u2452僢ᰣ缠ɋ乨\u0378䁡绑ס傓䁔瀾ሺÑ䀤ो刡开烀\u0A76Ё䈠䈰״Áj⁑䠡戢碠㘀አ䃉㪙嘈ʂø⸪௰₈㐲暤ƩDᬿ䂖剙書\u0FE0㴢\u0089㘩Ĉ䰵掀栰杁4〡Ƞ⭀\u1AE0㠰㹨Zコത\u009E䂖ࠠⴠ縣吠ᆠʡ㡀䀧否䣝Ӧ愠Ⓚ\u1CA2ಠո*①ӈԥ獀խ@㟬箬㐱\u31BE簽Ɛᩆᇞ稯禚⟶⣑аβǚ㥎Ḇ⌢㑆 搡⁗ဣ刣\u0C45䑒8怺₵⤦a5ਵ㏰ᩄ猢ฦ䬞㐷䈠呠カ愠ۀ\u1C92傠ᅼ߃ᙊ䢨ၠླྀš亀ƴ̰刷ʼ墨愠  "
4982                    )),
4983                    noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4984        }
4985
4986        /**
4987         * Copies the LocalMimicMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4988         * be shared to Noise classes.
4989         * @param other a LocalMimicMap to copy
4990         */
4991        public LocalMimicMap(LocalMimicMap other)
4992        {
4993            super(other);
4994            earth = other.earth.copy();
4995            earthOriginal = other.earthOriginal.copy();
4996            coast   = other.coast.copy();
4997            shallow = other.shallow.copy();
4998        }
4999
5000
5001
5002        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
5003                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
5004        {
5005            boolean fresh = false;
5006            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
5007            {
5008                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5009                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5010                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5011                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5012                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5013                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5014                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5015                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5016                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5017                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5018                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5019                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5020                cacheA = stateA;
5021                cacheB = stateB;
5022                fresh = true;
5023            }
5024            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
5025            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
5026            int t;
5027
5028            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
5029            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
5030
5031            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
5032
5033            if(zoom > 0)
5034            {
5035                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
5036                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
5037                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
5038                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
5039                }
5040                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5041                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5042            }
5043            else
5044            {
5045                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
5046                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
5047            }
5048            double p,
5049                    ps, pc,
5050                    qs, qc,
5051                    h, temp,
5052                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
5053                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
5054            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5055                xPos = startX * i_w;
5056                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
5057                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
5058                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
5059                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
5060
5061                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
5062                    {
5063                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5064                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5065                                yPos, seedA)) * 0.85;
5066                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
5067                            h += 0.05;
5068                        else
5069                            h += 0.15;
5070                    }
5071                    else
5072                    {
5073                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5074                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5075                                yPos, seedA)) * -0.9;
5076                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
5077                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
5078                        else
5079                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
5080                    }
5081                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
5082                    heightData[x][y] = h;
5083                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
5084                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
5085                            seedB));
5086                    temp = otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
5087                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
5088
5089                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
5090                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
5091                    if(fresh) {
5092                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
5093                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
5094
5095                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
5096                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
5097
5098                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
5099                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
5100                    }
5101                }
5102                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
5103                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
5104
5105            }
5106            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
5107                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
5108                    hMod;
5109            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
5110            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5111            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5112
5113            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5114                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5115                    h = heightData[x][y];
5116                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
5117                    hMod = 1.0;
5118                    switch (t) {
5119                        case 0:
5120                        case 1:
5121                        case 2:
5122                        case 3:
5123                            h = 0.4;
5124                            hMod = 0.2;
5125                            break;
5126                        case 6:
5127                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
5128                            break;
5129                        case 7:
5130                            h *= -0.25;
5131                            break;
5132                        case 8:
5133                            h *= -0.4;
5134                            break;
5135                        default:
5136                            h *= 0.05;
5137                    }
5138                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
5139                    if (fresh) {
5140                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
5141                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
5142                    }
5143                }
5144            }
5145            if(fresh)
5146            {
5147                minHeat1 = ps;
5148                maxHeat1 = pc;
5149            }
5150            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
5151            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5152            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5153            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5154            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5155
5156
5157            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
5158                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5159                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
5160                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
5161                    if (fresh) {
5162                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
5163                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
5164                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
5165                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
5166                    }
5167                }
5168            }
5169            if(fresh)
5170            {
5171                minHeat = qs;
5172                maxHeat = qc;
5173                minWet = ps;
5174                maxWet = pc;
5175            }
5176            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
5177        }
5178    }
5179}
